verses.text_plain: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
verses.verse_html:
1Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing? ▼
▼ rage: or, tumultuously assemble
 , ▼
▼ imagine: Heb. meditate

footnotes.body_html: ▼ rage: or, tumultuously assemble

verses.text_plain: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord, and against his anointed, saying,
verses.verse_html: 2The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord, and against his anointed, saying,

verses.text_plain: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.
verses.verse_html: 3Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

verses.text_plain: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
verses.verse_html: 4He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.text_plain: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.
verses.verse_html:
5Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure. ▼
▼ vex: or, trouble

verses.text_plain: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.
verses.verse_html:
6Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion. ▼
▼ set: Heb. anointed
 , ▼
▼ upon…: Heb. upon Zion, the hill of my holiness

footnotes.body_text: ▼ upon…: Heb. upon Zion, the hill of my holiness
footnotes.body_html: ▼ upon…: Heb. upon Zion, the hill of my holiness

verses.text_plain: I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
verses.verse_html:
7I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee. ▼
▼ the decree: or, for a decree

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the decree: or, for a decree
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the decree: or, for a decree

verses.text_plain: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.
verses.verse_html: 8Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

tokens.text: of me, and I shall give

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.
verses.verse_html: 9Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

tokens.text: thou shalt dash them in pieces

verses.text_plain: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.
verses.verse_html: 10Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

verses.text_plain: Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
verses.verse_html: 11Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

verses.text_plain: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
verses.verse_html: 12Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

tokens.text: all they that put their trust
